lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nevertheless, we have some background story on many of the characters you'll be seeing this evening to help you jump into the story. Let's go ahead and enjoy those in a minute, then we'll introduce the players. So have fun!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Most nights, Grog can be found challenging entire taverns to wrestling matches! Or accompanying Scanlan to the nearest house where you pay for lady favors. Also ale!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Part of the Aramente is proving yourself a strong warrior, a valiant protector, and a wise and compassionate leader. With this knowledge, one thought plays in repeat in her mind: Is she even worthy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: When he awoke, Percy began to design his first gun.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, you haven't heard of Scanlan Shorthalt? Well, gird your loins, ladies, because he has his eye on you. A talented musician, master of disguise, and dashingly handsome in his own mind, Scanlan sings songs almost as much as he sings his own praises. Born a poor gnome, Scanlan used his endless charm and soaring tenor voice to croon for coin and support his single mother. One day, he was discovered by a half-orc promoter, and joined Dr. Dranzel's Spectacular Traveling Troupe where he learned the ways of the world, and honed his skills as a bard extraordinaire. A loner much of his life, Scanlan has never quite come to terms with the violent death of his mother at the hands of a goblin invasion. While his years on the road provided many, shall we say, educational experiences with the opposite sex, deep down Scanlan yearns for the one thing he's never known: the true love of a fellow gnome. Still, Scanlan considers himself a lover first, performer second, and fighter distant third. On the battlefield, he'll support his allies, but rarely draws blood, unless it's to protect fellow gnome, Pike. Count on Scanlan for a hearty laugh, a rollicking song, and a twinkle in his eye that melts hearts and makes the females swoon.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Going from town to town and making friends and allies in and for the name of Draconia. Being a red dragonborn, I had quite the task on my hands in that respect, but it was exactly what I needed so I could explore the world and find these artifacts, as I felt the truth was out there. Some may describe me as buffoonish, but I say poppycock to all that. I am much sharper than most give me credit for. I just don't pay attention to things sometimes. I've also been known to be rather cunning, loyal, happy-go-lucky, and well, dangerous. I can't help but show my true scales every now and then. But overall, I think I'm quite friendly for a dragonborn.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Never entirely welcome in the company of elves or men, Vax'ildan learned at a young age to skip past formality, preferring instead to invite himself in your door. Along with twin sister Vex'ahlia, Vax was born by a chance encounter between elven royalty and human peasantry. Raised by their mother in their early years, the twins were eventually sent off to their father in the elven capital of Syngorn. But their cool reception among the elves there never warmed, and their time in the capital didn't last. The siblings stole away one autumn night and set out on the open road. After a few years of wandering, they eventually decided to return to their mother, and journeyed back to the lands of their youth. But instead of finding their childhood home, they returned to a pile of rubble. Their mother was gone, their home burned to ash. Pressing the townspeople for answers, they learned of the day the dragon came. With their ties all severed, Vax'ildan and his sister set out to find their fortune together in Tal'Dorei. An outsider since birth, Vax quickly learned to solve life's challenges in his own particular way, often by sidestepping them entirely. And when his knack for circumventing adversity isn't enough, the way of blades the elves schooled him in more than makes up the difference.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was at the age of ten when the two were taken from their mother, and brought to live in Syngorn, the isolated elven city for which their father was an ambassador. He quietly took them in, but always kept an icy distance, and after too many years of disdainful looks, the pair decided to leave his indifference behind, and set out on their own. Vax took to the cities, stealing small trinkets and learning the ways of the thief, while Vex kept to the woods. She preferred the isolation. Always the keen observer, she learned to hunt and to track, to spy and to shoot. Through a series of fateful events, earned herself a companion in the form of a bear-- her own stolen Trinket-- to fight alongside her and protect her fiercely. Also, he is adorable, and gives expert massages. Like so many half-elves--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of our players was a gunslinger, for which there are no rules for in 5th edition. So I had to create and customize those for the game, so bear with us on that. That will be an interesting ride, regardless. We do have an eight-player game we've been playing for two years, which is a little crazy, which is why we go a little loose with the rules. It's a great group, it's a lot of fun. Not everyone can make every game, so we have enough players to definitely pull a party each time.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Just so you know, we're having an audio bottleneck. It'll take about 30 seconds to work itself out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, audio bottleneck.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Tech problems that make me want to murder someone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay. Just a second. You let us know when it's okay to talk.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know what that means, a bottleneck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are we all right? And how are we? Exterminate. Exterminate.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is the mic adjusted? Is it any better?

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Better now. We're good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unfortunately, she's in London accepting a BAFTA, so I think we're okay. For the Last of Us. That's harsh. Also no donations this week, but going forward we will have donations available for those that will help partially run the show from our wonderful cameraman and crew. Also, half of our donations will go to the 826 charity. Marisha, if you want to talk a little about that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's 826LA, you should look it up. There's a few all over the country.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. Also, as a heads up because I saw some of you guys ask me in the chatroom: These videos will be available on the Geek & Sundry YouTube Channel soon enough, as well as a more extensive backstory of the party. We'll have all that content ready for you so you don't have to memorize it. Maybe a bio page, I don't know. We'll figure something out. It'll be fine. Anyway, let's open that up. You know who I am. Matthew Mercer, voice actor and I've been running this game for two years. I'm a hardcore nerd. Let's go around the table and introduce our players so you can attach the faces to the intros you just saw. Let's start on this side with Travis.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh! Hi. I'm Travis Willingham, voice actor, gamer. I play Grog the goliath barbarian.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hi. I'm Laura Bailey. I'm also, you know, a voice actor like everyone here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. I think we all are.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm playing Vex'ahlia. The coolest chick ever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The ranger with the bear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The ranger with the bear named Trinket, in case you didn't catch that. His name is Trinket and he's amazing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This one's twin. We're half-elven twins. I started playing D&D when I was 13 and I can't believe this is happening. So cheers. Cheers to this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There was a problem. I'm playing Percy, the Gunslinger. I'm the reason all the rules are all messed up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I am Keyleth, the druid from the tribe of the Air Ashari. I am a half-elven person.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you're elven.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, half-elf.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Half-elf. Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, Come on, man. I've been half-elf since day one. Half-elven. Yes! You can see me shooting lightning and turning into awesome animals.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Orion.

lines.name: ORION, MATT
lines.text: Hi.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Hey, everybody. I'm Orion Acaba and I'm also a voice actor. I do things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, I'm Marisha Ray, by the way.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did I say that?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Keyleth is Marisha Ray.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let Orion have his moment. Don't try and break--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, it's our moment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. All right.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm Tiberius the awesome sorcerer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dragonborn sorcerer.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Dragonborn, yeah! That's right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm Sam Riegel: a voice actor, and stuff. My character is Scanlan Shorthalt. The gnome bard who sings a lot. Let's start playing, yeah? (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Part way through the battle, Grog managed to recognize one of them as a previous ally and no longer an ally at this time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Son of a bitch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, the barbarian for his first and only time so far managed to avert battle through a social encounter and rolled pretty damn well on a persuasion check. So you got one. You get one. You got your one. Never again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Next time he dies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Essentially. Which managed to not turn it into complete bloodshed. You continued on your way to Kraghammer, presented your paperwork, were given entry into the city and that is where we begin this adventure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In the city of Kraghammer?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In the city of Kraghammer.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow! This is fantastic.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're in, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes. We were at the door. We were talking to someone right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All warmed with the red glow of some strange, crimson rock peppered throughout the town as a light source. A large metal forge envelops the center of this cylindrical city. The entire is a three-tiered cylindrical city that is built into the ground of the mountain itself. Welcome to Kraghammer!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Remind us. Did we bullshit our way in here, or did--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, we had a way in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, Allura got your paperwork so you were actually able to get in this time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But, Ashley speaks Dwarvish. Pike speaks--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike speaks Dwarvish and she's not here.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I speak Dwarvish as well!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh good!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's fantastic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The only other bit of information you have about the whereabouts of her is that she came here to go into the mine Apparently, a mithral mine where this evil is supposedly brewing. You heard that the one person who owns the biggest part of the mithral market here cornering, his name was the dwarven Lord Nostoc Greyspine. That was the only name you had in regards to this deep earth quarry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Greyspine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Greyspine, correct.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have to go find him, don't we?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think before we do anything we should find a place to sleep.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That's true!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh! We're all jacked up from before, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wouldn't it be nice to put everything down for a little while.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Of course. I've got a lot of

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Good way to phrase that, Scanlan. Also, I would like to check out any places where they might have enchanted libraries or what not.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you stick with us? You're the only one that speaks Dwarvish.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, you're getting ahead of yourself.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm just saying put it on the list.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's look around. Are there any dwarves in the vicinity?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, there are many! As you finish this conversation you look about there are two guards posted nearby wearing dark crimson and brass chest plates that have a uniform scar carved across the front. It's actually built into the armor itself as a design. They're both staring awkwardly at all of you arguing in the middle of this entry thoroughfare of Kraghammer.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tiberius, make with the dwarf-talk, please.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Hello, friends. My associates and I were looking for a place of lodging for the night and a place of reputable reputation.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One dwarf shouts over to another one, "You hear that, Jepson?! They're looking for a place to "stay." "Aye, I heard that right. It's about time we had some new folk in town. Well, if you're "looking for a place to stay I'd say your best bet would be the Pig Pits."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that the name of a place?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes! Certainly! The Pig Pits."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ask for the Pig Pits--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Those are actually pig pits, isn't it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like we're being hazed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What?! No! Not at all."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That sounds fine with me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is Common?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is all in Common, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Which way to the Pig Pits, sir?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Pig Pits are that way." He points over the edge and you see down past the central forge structure in the city to the very bottom nearby a large temple that envelops the bottom floor of Kraghammer proper there is indeed a distant slop of mud where internal livestock are being kept.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I bring out a piece of gold. Please, sir, we're looking for a place to stay that isn't covered in mud.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's good to see that at least one of you speaks Dwarvish." Takes the coin, kinks it in his teeth and goes, "All right, now if you're looking for a proper place to stay you're going to look "for the Iron Hearth Tavern. That is to your left up that way no more than a half mile. Keep an eye "out. Listen for the laughter and the people who are very drunk. That's your best bet."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you, sir.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No worries."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like your armor by the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, thank you kindly."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Was that a wink?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's all she does.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's all I do is wink at people.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a nervous tic, really.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a feat she took. You progress to the western side of the Kraghammer rotation as you curl around the central platform. Making your way eventually to the outside of this rather large, central tavern inn. As you walk in, you can hear music playing, you can hear laughter and boastful cheer, you can hear some arguments in the distance. You can hear it from a good two or three buildings away. This is definitely a central social environment here in Kraghammer. As you walk inside, you-- Let me get some proper tavern music here for you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Smells in here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Drinking territory.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear some loud boisterous (hearty dwarven laughter), some drinks being clinked together. As you walk in, the first thing that catches you is the scent of stale alcohol and smoked wood of some kind.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In the center of the room, there looks to be a not currently in use, specifically built brawling circle. It's about 30 feet by 20 feet. It's more of an oval. It's not in use, currently.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: An octagon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Essentially.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How high is the ceiling here? Can Grog fit in here?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh right, am I like--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The ceiling actually is considered vaulted ceiling for dwarves so it runs at about seven feet. For Grog, it's uncomfortable, almost scratching your head across the top. As you enter, about seven or eight of the nearby dwarves at the front door go, (hearty laughter). They look immediately at the ragtag non-dwarven group that just stumbled into the center of the tavern.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What're you looking at?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's not very often we get someone with that kind of a mug on you. Let me buy you a drink, come "sit down!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: My kind of people, see you later! I go grab the drink with the lovely dwarves.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We grab a table next to the dwarves with Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both tables next to the table they're at are completely filled with dwarves.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take a sack of gold out of my own pocket, slam it down on the table--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A sack of gold, are you crazy?!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bartender!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's looking around, she's staring confused at you and all eyes are on her, and she goes, "Well, "it's about time someone around here had some generosity! Certainly, pay upfront. Drinks all "around on this half-elven gentleman."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let it rain! (cheering)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Make it rain.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like a cask of ale.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll need your largest bowl of ale for this one here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Cask. Cask of ale. Cask.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No worries, Adra's got your back, be right back." She wanders off to the back room, comes back and starts pouring stein after stein after stein of ale.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Keep going. Looks good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do notice she is definitely the head of this tavern and all of her barkeeps are male and seem to be worked rather ragged.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What was her name?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Excuse me, miss. You.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Adra. Yeah?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sorry?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Adra."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Adra! You run a fantastic establishment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's right I do!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you for welcoming us and allowing us to buy this round.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course. Patrons that come and drop coin like that are welcome any time."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, thank you for your hospitality. Might we inquire about staying here the night? Do you have an inn with the establishment?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She reaches below and pulls out a big tome and starts thumbing through it. "You know, "actually we have openings right now on the second floor."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Several rooms, or just one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Do you need them side by side?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That would be nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We could pull him there and push him into room seven."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Something with a little bed for me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right, so I can get a room for each of you. We're "looking at eight rooms separately, that will run you per evening about 25 gold pieces. Does that sound about right?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Total?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "25 total pieces."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You want to share a room?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah! We'll bunk up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grog, you and me. I can sleep on your feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Probably like 15 gold then for just that amount.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 gold per room."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're penny pinchers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "How long do you expect to stay?"

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: At least a few days.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'd say a week.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With an indefinite hold, we have business in the city.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right! Well how bout we pay the week in advance and I'll give you a discount?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's the discount?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait. I thought we were going to be heading south?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let's say, 100 gold for the week, all five rooms."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're pretty flush, I think we can handle it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. That works.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This doesn't terrify me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think I did the math wrong.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I was told there would be no math.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sounds good!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Gah! I hate not having a calculator! Fine!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ah! Great!" She pulls back and pulls some keys out and hands them to the rest of you. Hands you some paperwork, shows you which rooms are yours and says, "You're welcome to stay all you "like, ask questions, hang about. Just make sure you don't do anything stupid near the Carvers."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Ooh! Like what? I do things like that all the time!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sorry. Our Dwarvish is a little thick. Near the--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The Carvers, the Carvers!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The carvas. Of course.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The Carvers!"

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: The Converse! Of course!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Car Verse?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Is this your first time in Kraghammer?"

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The Carvers are the guard that run this city. They're the ones that keep the law."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The scar!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, the armor, the Carvers!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, what is with the scar? I've got one myself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She leans back and as you reveal the rather gnarled scar on your chest. She reels back a bit and two of the nearby dwarves go, "Yeah!" They chug down their drinks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! More drinking!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They start showing their scars and are like, "Oh no! I got this one from an iron bolt!" They start talking about different creatures they fought. "All right. Well, the Carvers are a bit of "a-- how do I put it? A military class in this city. They run a very tight ship on the streets, "so be careful."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That shouldn't be a problem. Mostly we are looking for Lord Greyspine, if I recall. We have business with him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We might have business with you, if you've seen a halfling come through.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She thinks to herself and goes, "There was a halfling woman, but she was staying at the "Firebrook Inn."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Firebrook.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There was talk about her. She got in a few fights "herself. The one with the silver armor? That one? Yeah, she was a firebrand if ever I saw one. Right up my alley, I like that one."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How long ago would you say this was?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, she went through a few weeks. I haven't seen her recently."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you. Perfect.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there a champion of the circle of fighting in the tavern? Is there a reigning--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Already, Grog?!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I have to know these things!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He has to do something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She turns the barrel that she has on the table towards you a little bit and you can see the actual symbol, this burned image on the side that says, "Balgus Brewery." She goes, "That'll be Balgus. The one "that supplies us with what you're drinking. He's the undefeated champion. But I don't think he's "quite right to fight at the moment." She points towards the very edge of the bar and you see one older grizzled dwarf, long gray hair pulled into straight braids in the back, big bushy beard that's all shoved up into his face because he's asleep, drunk as a skunk, on the edge of the bar.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: My type of dwarf. Maybe we'll can use him as a merc later or something. All right, another time then.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Another time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Save it for a rainy day.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does it rain down here?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think they have rainy days.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You said Greyspine?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, Greyspine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We are looking to set up a meeting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Which Greyspine?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nostoc?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Nostoc Greyspine. He's definitely a business type one."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Well who's the friendlier Greypsine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The friendlier of the types would probably be the head of House Greyspine."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, how many Greypsines are there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, well there's probably several at this point, I've lost track. The family line's been "going for a while. However, of House Greyspine currently, Ironkeeper Gradim Greyspine is the head "of this entire city. Voted in ten years ago, actually. He's head of the council."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ironkeeper what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ironkeeper Gradim Greypsine. Gradim! You're-- (sigh) These commoners. Learn to speak "the language!"

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I understood!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Adra, may I ask, obviously we have no dwarves in our little party.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Unfortunately."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Unfortunately for us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sorry, about that. You're very welcoming. We appreciate that. How welcoming would you say the city is to outsiders? Would we stick out like a sore thumb?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Probably. As long as you don't do anything stupid. As long as you keep the coin flowing, and "as long as you stay to the upper levels. The lower levels you get to more of the business: the "miners, the forges, the foundries. When you get to the business areas, that's where the guard gets "heavier and that's where folks don't like you poking near their money."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So the lower levels would have the mithral mines?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There is one now. It's all been, and has been for quite some time, completely helmed up and "run by House Greypsine. The Keystone Quarry is what you're looking for."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're not really interested in that. We just want to see the city. Our business is elsewhere.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, I would not recommend it. Not without proper business credentials on that. You'll end up "being questioned very heavily."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sounds like a dirty business, anyway.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, you want to stay away from those miners Scanlan, that's a dirty business.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She gives you a look almost like it was a slightly racist statement, but then passes it off because you paid her a lot of coin today.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So racist.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So No-stock. Nostoc?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nostoc.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nostoc Greyspine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You said that he's kind of a--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, there's a reason he's the one put in charge of the mines and the businesses and the foundries."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Where is he located, exactly?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, if he's not home at the actual Greyspine Manor-- which is a sprawling house. It contains all the ones who live there."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going there!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He's probably down at the actual--" What is it? Pardon. Bear with me. Consult my notes! "He's "probably down by the Greyspine quarry itself, keeping an eye on the business there." There's a nearby dwarf having a few drinks, goes, "Ah, Greyspine, there's been troubles round there! "Apparently, a friend of mine works there. Got a big, nasty scar last week. Wouldn't even pay him "for his time off to heal. It's bullshit!" He slams his drink down on the table.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Down at the quarry?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Aye."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How did your friend get this nasty cut?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He works there! Said there was things pouring out of the caves. Goblins and the like!"

lines.name: LAURA, SAM
lines.text: Goblins?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ah, goblins are nothing."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Seems there's something other than goblins poking out through this hole. Just saying, that "business is in for a serious problem if it doesn't change."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does your friend ever have drinks here? "No. He's been sober for two years. We're not "friends anymore." Tugs on his beard a little bit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh. I'm sorry. I think.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A lot to process.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He pours another drink. At which point, Adra slaps his hand and says, "Pay that. He bought one round!" He finishes his drink and walks away.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Excuse me, one thing, Adra, are there any mystics in this particular town that study any arcane arts?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course! What, you think dwarves are just the baseline folks who brawl each other?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So many racist comments. Jeez!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What you're looking for is House Thunderbrand. They are the ones who, by blood, "have the arcane arts in their family line."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Interesting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They run most of the enchantment process in the city, they also train-- they call it train, "some of us call it more 'indoctrination.' But, they're definitely the focus of all arcane arts "here in Kraghammer."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you for your time, Adra. Carry on with your evening. We'll seek you out if we have any more questions.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Certainly. Now if you don't mind," She scoots you aside, and you see a line, a queue of dwarves behind her, with their empty cups, waiting to get to her to fill up the drinks that you bought.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's-- we did promise that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Enjoy, gentlemen! And lady.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What time of day is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You just arrived, probably around 3:00 or 4:00 in the afternoon, so you're probably pushing sunset right about now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do dwarves carry the same schedule?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does anyone know?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's only one way to find out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an intelligence check!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh! Roll it! You're the first one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: First die rolling. Nice!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 18, plus, what is that? Investigation? Or insight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This would be a straight intelligence roll on this one, so your general knowledge of dwarves.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. 20, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20. That's not too bad! In your experience, you know dwarves, depending on their lifestyle and what they do for a living, their clocks can run differently, but for the most part, they run in tandem with most other races just because it makes it easier for dealing with outside forces. But, like I said, it's very variable. There is no set, locked time of: this is morning, this is evening, they just sleep when they need to and wake up when they need to.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. Good to know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's like living in Alaska.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right!

lines.name: MATT, MARISHA
lines.text: Dwarven Alaska.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, fellows, what should we do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Check out the Firebrook Inn, yes. That was where Lady Kima was staying. Also, I think somebody should run reconnaissance on Greyspine Manor.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like stealth, you mean?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes. I don't think we should try to go directly to the mines and find Nostoc.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Agreed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I think maybe we should enlist the help of a dwarf here in the city to introduce us to Nostoc. I mean, we're not trying to raise hell, or bring down a thousand dwarves upon us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's no sense attempting to be subtle.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Although, that does sound fun.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Everyone's going to know that we're here, and what we're looking for by morning.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why don't we get old Drunky Greybeard that's got his face down on the bar to do it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe he's drunk enough to help us. Saddle up, Grog!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Me?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: People seem to like you here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, but I'm really-- oh, that's true.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're the connoisseur.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe I'll part my armor, so he can see the scar. Post up on the bar.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Take him a drink!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, take him a drink. A very large drink.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to get the largest goblet you have of ale, and I would like to go over to, what was his name? Bulbous?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Balgus.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Balgus.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I had it right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Close.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Balgus. I would like to--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm coming with Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes. I would like to go up and put my scar, and post up on the bar and (throat clearing)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (snores)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (louder throat clearing)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I take out my flute and I play a little Healing Words spell and try to heal him of his drunkenness.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just a little of his drunkenness, not all of his drunkenness.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He likes him drunk, so maybe like, half.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You play your tune, a beautiful little tune that saunters through the air.The magical energies emanate from the notes you make, drift into his torso; you can see a slight glow and he, "(grumbling) Where's that blasted music coming from?" His hand goes out and paws towards the flute.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Huh, I don't know where that was coming from.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm sorry to disturb you, your name is of great repute around these parts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He wipes a globule of drool that's crusted into his beard. "Aye, you've bothered me nap. What "do you want from Balgus?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We were wondering if we might, perchance, acquire your knowledge about town, for a bit of a search.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispered) Talk to him about fighting first.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, I hear you're a good fighter. You look strong.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I've heard the same."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right. How often do you get challengers in this tavern?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not as often as I get woken up from my sleep. Which is never. Because only stupid people "do that."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Lost cause. Abandon ship!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right. I have an intelligence of six, I know what I'm doing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There is a very pretty lady over there, with slightly pointy ears. (whispering) I'm talking about you or you. (normal volume) There's two of them! They were actually wanting to ask you a question if you wouldn't mind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion roll.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Me?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why is he doing this?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why would you throw this to us?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Because I was either going to fight him or I was going to throw boobs at him, and I went with boobs.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He realized he was sinking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Throw Boobs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Persuasion. Oh! Good roll.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Look at that: one. 19!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Woo!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19? He takes a moment, and grabs the drink that you prepared from his hand and goes (gulps).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice form.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You've got five minutes." Then he stretches his back a bit. This gnarled hunch that he holds in his physical posture, flexes it a bit, and now you can see the rippling muscles that show beneath his tunic. This is a built dwarf. You don't know what past he's had, moving boulders or forging crazy iron shit, but there's a reason this guy has a reputation. He stands up off of his stool, which you can now hear crack with the weight of a dwarf, which are made for normal dwarves. This guy is solid muscle. He saunters over, looks about for a second, almost like he's looking for his next target. Sees the pointy ears, sees the pointy ears, and goes (sighs) and saunters up to the table, slams his hand down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why is he coming towards us?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Because I told him to. Because you're supposed to ask him--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Boobs!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Steady as she goes, ladies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He sits down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispered to Laura) You're better at this than I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You called for Balgus, why?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! Hello, Balgus.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hi, Balgus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We just heard you're so impressive and masculine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We really wanted to talk to you.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I use my Earring of Whisper to Vex. Cool it down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh sh-- okay.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Calm down. Not so sexy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I reach out and I stroke his bicep because I can't hear that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Keyleth, stop doing that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I disagree, heat it up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Roll so good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm really low in charisma. I'm really awkward. Persuasion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll your persuasion.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (groans)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, what was it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I rolled a two?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Plus my persuasion of zero, because I have a shitty charisma.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As your arm reaches for his bicep--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I didn't say anything. I just touched him!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As your arm reaches for his bicep, his hand, belying his grumpy, half-asleep haze-- with unnatural speed reaches out and slaps your hand to the side. Not painfully, but just, "No touching "the drunk dwarf."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry about my friend, Balgus. She's just so impressed with your muscles. We've heard amazing things about you here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Have you?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We've heard that no fighter can match your skill.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You've heard correct."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We've heard that you know more about this town than anyone else.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I've been around a bit, yeah."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. I bet nobody knows more about the Greyspines than you do and they've been around a long time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Political ass minds is what they are."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Assmanes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not keen to them-- ass minds."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ass mines?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They've got minds of an ass."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, I thought you meant like, mines that ex-- Sorry. Go ahead. No, ass minds. Yes, they have ass minds.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The Greyspines are no friend of mine. "

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I've heard they're terrible. What do you do, Balgus?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What do I do? I own the brewery in town!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasp) You do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The only one."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The best brewery?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The only! Of course it's the best!" I've put everyone out of business. We export to most of Tal'Dorei."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This ale is amazing, that I'm drinking right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Damn right it is!" You set it down and he takes it from your hand a little bit and takes a sip himself and sets it down again. (inhales deeply) (spits)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It seems that you aren't challenged often in business and in fighting.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I saunter over. Hello! My name is Tiberius Stormwind!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're all going to die.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He glances over and says, "Dragonborn. I haven't fought one of your kind in a long time."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh! Who's the last dragonborn you fought? Do you remember his name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I recall his name was 'Broken and Bloody.'"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think that's a friend of yours.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, I know him! I know the Bloody family, they're terrible people. Anyway, my associates and I were wondering if you might come-- Is that what we're doing? Trying to get him to come with us?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Anyway!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're trying to find out more about Greyspine. Where he might be or who his associates might be.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Gee, I'm so glad you came over.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Would you like to accompany us on this journey that we're taking? We're trying to find the Greyspines and you seem like you would want to come in on this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We think there might be something rotten in the mines.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion roll. You can assist if you like.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm assisting in this persuasion roll, good god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That just means he has advantage.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, I get advantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, so you get advantage on this roll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So you roll twice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What was the first thing you rolled?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Three. I'll take the 18.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Definitely take that 18.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh and plus my--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Persuasion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks at you keenly, which--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Which is a nine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa, you have a nine persuasion?!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That's why I talk.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's pretty charismatic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes, "Well no, I don't really want to go anywhere with you. But if you're looking to go "ahead and talk to the Greyspines, you don't want to go empty-handed. It's customary to come with a "gift of some kind."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh really?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What might they like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, let's just say, I have the finest brewery in the city."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have some fine, very rare, very exotic drinks that I could, perchance, sell to you."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pay the dwarf.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much for this exotic ale?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "How exotic you wanting?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We want to get in the door. We want him to like us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This, I personally oversaw. It took me four years to fill this barrel full. It'll cost you 500 gold "pieces. But it is a king's red wine!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a persuasion check-- a perception check to see if he's lying?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This would be insight. Go ahead and roll insight.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to go walk over to Grog really quickly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He seems too drunk to lie.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's just do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tell you what, Balgus. We have some very rare items with us that I think you might be interested in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Make it quick! You've got one minute."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We've got one minute? Well, we've got--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "My time is far worth the 500 gold you've already been talking about."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We've got this with us right now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We've got a bunch of dragon pieces.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Do you like dragon pieces?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We've got 37 dragon teeth, one dragon eye, four cups of dragon blood--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We've got this cup of dragon blood! Which I know can be added to ale or wine and makes it quite sensational.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He takes the sealed cup and sloshes it around in his hand. The actual liquid is coagulated to such a point that it's less of a blood and more of a gelatin. (sloshing sounds)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It gets better with age.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Exactly, a spoon of it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He peeks it open and (sniffs). "Yes!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think that's really expensive, actually.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can have this appraised, but if you want to do a straight trade for the barrel for this, "I'll take you up on that."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit, no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just go for it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right, fine! One cup of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right." He takes the cup, puts it in a small satchel on his side. "Adra!" "Aye, what do "you want, you drunken bastard?" "They've bought me thistle blood wine. Take it out back. Here's the "key." He tosses her the key. She grabs it and goes, "Really? Ooh, just walked in, they're buying "fancy." She comes back with two of her barmaiders who are begrudgingly carrying it with her. It's a nice barrel. It has a gold trim. The actual bands that hold the wood together is gold. The branding on the side is gold leafed into the wood. It's fine, exquisite, we're talking top shelf BevMo-style, awesome dwarven wine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Top shelf at BevMo!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He pats it and he goes, "All yours. If this doesn't get you in the door, I'll eat my shoe."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Have you ever done that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Maybe, I forget a lot of nights."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where might that door be?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Minute's up, you'll have to ask around, but it was great doing business with you." He walks away from the table.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I put it in the bag of holding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It does not fit in the bag of holding.

lines.name: LAURA, TRAVIS
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The barrel is too big, you barely got Dork the ox in there. Which, for the record, they did fit a small ox in the bag of holding and then realized later on that there was no airflow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He came out!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel like we weren't going to discuss that. I felt that that was in the past.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I felt that was a necessary story.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe if we drank some of it it would fit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The troll dick. Is that still in there or no?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, we actually got rid of the troll dick.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did we trade the troll dick for something?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought we like used it as a weapon.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I offered it up, but by that time it had turned into a slimy--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ew.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought we threw it at somebody.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I stop Adra then and ask her where Greyspine Manor is? Keep, manor, whatever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ah, well I can have him do it." She pokes one of the barmaiders who turns around. This one's younger, he looks like he's frazzled and maybe new here or at least trying to make his way. He goes, "Okay, I can show you around, just follow me outside, come follow me." He walks out. He's got a little apron on. He leads you guys outside. He brings you to the edge of the outer walkway of the central ring you're on. He points across the way and what you can see is a series of marble pillars that outline a residential district that opens and consumes the other side of the central ring of Kraghammer. He says, "If you go past far in that way, you'll look for the house of Greyspine. It's "the one that has dark black marble with gold tinting inside the spiralling vein of the marble, "it's gold. The gate outside is wrought iron, black iron, that's topped with a series of pikes and--" Pike awkwardly looks sickened, not understanding. "The real key point is, if you look "on the front yard, you'll see a dwarven statue of the current ironkeeper himself. That's where "you'll want to go."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, very helpful, young man.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you so much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course. If you get the chance, you could fill out a little form saying how helpful I've been--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are there suggestion cards here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, absolutely.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Here." He pulls out a small parchment and hands it to you. It's handwritten with a couple of checkboxes.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: You should give us all a copy so you will have multiple.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I only have one."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, okay, that's fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sorry!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Confidence needs improvement.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, it's okay, we have a wonderful writer.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll rustle up a few. That's fine, why not. It's what I do, apparently.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He runs back into the tavern.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, shall we go to the manor?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we want to do the manor right now? What time is it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We got to sleep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We might not want to bug him when he's, you know, having dinner.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's be honest, that gate's going to jack us up. It's going to be full of trouble.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, yes, let's go sleep.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's sleep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, it's only 6:00.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, then we have time to do other things.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: How long is a short rest?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Short rest is around ten minutes or so.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I want to take short rest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've technically been short resting in the tavern. It's more of like a post battle-- like, take a breather, bandage your wounds, settle yourself after a harrowing experience. That's what a short rest is.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What was the arcane magic, the manor?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, what you're looking for is the House Thunderbrand.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I want to head in that direction.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you're dividing from the party? Okay.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, I'm going to House Thunderbrand, if anybody wants to come with me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are you doing? I can't understand you with that popcorn in your mouth.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Sorry! I'm going to House Thunderbrand before turning in this evening. I've had a nice little short rest and I would like to ask them a few questions.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, go ahead, okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there any recon that's going to happen tonight?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think that you and I are going to go to Greyspine?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We'll check out the house.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you need any help?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure, you can come with us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I don't want you to say yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then no, we'll stealth our way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's very strange, are you all right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike's not listening, she's looking at the chat room.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's feeling ill. Does she need to lie down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike is feeling, and for those of you who are curious in the chat room, once again, elements of this are house ruled, so don't complain.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, players.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We keep short rest to ten minutes because it makes it move faster. Pike is going along, she seems to be a little distracted, she can't quite understand. She says, "I don't know, I feel like "I've been here before. It's hard to explain."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Anyway, I'm probably going to go rest for the evening." She heads back to the tavern.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The fuck does that mean?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll find out next week.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But first, whores in the bedroom!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Lovely.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grog and I go in search of a, shall we say politely, whorehouse.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The polite term.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, the cleric's away, the bard shall play.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We need a massage. On my crotch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You and I stealth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys make your way to the Greyspine Manor, you guys head for that, you head to Thunderbrand.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is Grog going to find someone his size?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Percy and I spend some time making some really nice comment cards for--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to make some beautiful comment cards.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: For what's his name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: His name is Balan.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Balan.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're going to make some wonderful comment cards for Balan.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, Percy is wonderful with calligraphy; you've shown me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you'll get to that. You guys do manage to find what's called The Stone's Pillow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The Stone's Pillow?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Stone's Pillow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I love it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's an establishment of comfort and ease, and will run you both for the evening, as you are not Kraghammer locals, 30 gold for the night each.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A bargain.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll take it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 30 gold?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What sort of ladies will we find there?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Bearded ladies.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What species?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The madam of the house introduces you to a spectrum of ladies, mostly dwarven, and very attractive, you know. This is a nice establishment. There is one gnome. One female gnome. There are a number of male dwarves as well, that are standing at the ready. There is one elf, looks a little shy and embarrassed that a goliath walked in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And that's our choice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Those are your choices.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll take the tallest one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take a dwarf.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She is aggressive and throws you around. You got your money's worth. You get manhandled in a way that you haven't-- You're going to be sore in the morning.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome to Kraghammer, gentlemen.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I like it already.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, you guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you just walking up to the manor?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, we're going to try to check out what it looks like. See what the guards are like.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, we'll pretend to take a stroll.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pose as a married couple.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ew, no.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just for the purposes of sneaking around the house.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (retching)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to see what the area's like.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How about we pose as brother and sister, creepy? (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You come on to every human, orc, and half-elf in the entire kingdom, but pretending to be my wife for 30 minutes is too much.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. It's disgusting, so no.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're probably right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's got standards.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. So we'll take a stroll. Shop, see what the area's like.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You enter the residential district. It is dark and you see the red stone that permeates the area for a low gentle glow of the entire city is now clustered into these street lamps that are throughout the entire location. You begin to press into the residential district proper. There's some nice homes that are carved into the side of the rock, there's some stand-alone homes that are built out of fine stone. You eventually make your way towards the nicer part of it, where you start seeing some of the more marble buildings, some of the more exotic stonework being used in the construction of the homes. You also notice three of the guards that are part of the city establishment there are following you from behind, curiously. The Carvers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit, the Carvers. Shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No weapons drawn, but definitely hands at the ready.

lines.name: LAURA, LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we could just keep walking.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could, but that could be bad.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes. No, we just want to look at the house.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Louder!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean we're not going to go sneaking in in the day.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's say which ones are very obvious about being pretty, so we look like we're just sightseeing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chuckles darkly) As you continue to walk, eventually some of the dwarves approach.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I point and say: Oh! Look at that one, with the carving, it's amazing!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The architecture is divine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Divine!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (snorts) They're posing as the Howells?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Lovey, would you look at this dwarven home?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get about 20 more feet before you get, "Hail! Hail!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my! Yes? (giggles)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You foreigners are wandering too far in districts you don't belong to. What's your business?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh I'm so sorry, I was just so amazed by the architecture here. I wanted to see the beautiful sculpture.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We definitely are visitors here, sir, no one has explained the rules to your city. We were just taking in the fantastic architecture and history of Kraghammer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We were told there was a beautiful sculpture down the street of the ruler of Kraghammer?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion roll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh jesus.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Either of you, whichever you prefer.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If only I was there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow! Pretty decent, good for you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The guards look at each other. The one that was talking to you, you can see now, as he comes a little closer into the light, a frazzled black beard that's pulled into a very tight braid that goes down to his bellybutton. All wearing the same basic chest plate; long, black velvet cloak behind; each carrying some sort of heavy warhammer around the side of their belt. Steps up and says, "Well, just to tell you the rules here, if you're going to wander at night in a very expensive "district, you don't want to do it by yourself because you either have chances of being mugged or "arrested. We might have arrested you."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no! I'm so sorry! Well, do we need protection?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of them looks over and sees the bear that is off in the shadows nearby.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought Trinket stayed behind. Cool, cool!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket's quietly trying to keep up with his wonderful master.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come along Trinket, there there's nothing to be scared of.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What's a bear doing in Kraghammer?!" They all grab out their warhammers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, please, he's quite harmless. In fact, he's very scared of most people.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Doesn't he do tricks?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He does. Trinket show them your wonderful shake trick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point Trinket, (subdued growling) just shakes his whole body. He looks at you, confused.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then raises a paw up, and-- (bear noises)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If you put your hand out, he'll shake your hand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (growling)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, see!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The dwarves take a step back as the claw goes through the, "That's all right. I would say "if that's your animal--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "--don't bring it here."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, good to know. Trinket, head back to that tavern, would you? People are getting nervous.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (growling)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I love you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket begins to walk back. A couple of other dwarves that are wandering carrying some packages to the side make a very wide berth around this armored bear that's slowly moping its way through the streets of Kraghammer. What could possibly go wrong?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's so cute.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's a sweetheart, he's fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (growls) You hear in the distance. The one goes like, "Look, I'll show you to the statue and "that's it, then you got to go."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't see many half-elves here and honestly I'm excited to meet you, so let's do this "quickly. Come with me." He leads you further into the cityscape. Down the road, you end up going through a few buildings. You find one large wrought iron fence with a series of carved spikes towards the top, and you see the beautiful dark marble building with the gold trim.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, this one's amazing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This is what you were talking about, Greyspine Manor. Lot of rich sons of bitches."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow, so you said the Greyspines own this one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Aye."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's stunning. We only heard about the building itself; what can you tell us about the people who live here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Bunch of rich sons of bitches."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we can tell that can't we?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Actually, Ironkeeper's all right, he's been doing a great job. The rest of the family can suck off."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, really?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not liked by the rest of the city, then?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, they have friends everywhere, but I personally don't like them. They run business "pretty dark. They work most of their employees to the ground. To the bone."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't think that's how you run a business. Well, that's how you run a business for "profit, but not for--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow. It sounds like they would run the mithral mine which we've heard is so hard on its employees.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Aye, that's the one."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah. I don't know, I don't go that far south, doesn't interest me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nor us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Smells like brimstone."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't blame you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We prefer the company of good hard working people, like yourself. We're very impressed with the work the Carvers do in this city, from what little we've seen so far, so hats off to you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're born into it. We spend most of our time "training, which can get very boring." You see that two of the dwarves that are now about two steps behind go, "(clears throat) All right, Thompson! We got to get back to our post!" "Oh, sorry. Look, "we've dillied about too much. Just follow us back, go about your business, don't wander here at "night, and good luck."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you so much.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you. We follow for a couple of blocks, behind them for a bit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Make sure that they're paying attention to us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. They bring you back towards the entrance of the residential district.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then we stealth and--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: -- split off, yes, we can split off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, roll stealth, both of you guys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Am I currently being beaten by a whore dwarf or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a constitution check!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Constitution check?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hang strong, buddy!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That's a mouthful. 'Whore dwarf.'

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus your constitution modifier. Actually, athletics! Go athletics!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Plus two! 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have impressed your female dwarf.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you making a sex check?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes! I'm sex checking.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whore dwarf!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That happened. That's the first time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (grunting)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is so uncomfortable.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So that happened. What'd you guys roll for stealth?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He rolled a 20, I rolled a 15.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's okay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys begin to wander off--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No! They're professional Carvers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- Vax, you vanish. Vex, you take a couple steps. You hear, "Hey, hey, hey! I told you, it's "dangerous down there in the dark! Don't do that!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Where's your friend?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, he already went back to the tavern that we're staying at. I was wondering if maybe you could show me around the rest of the town?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks to the other guards and they're obviously fed up with his flirting, and they're not too keen on you guys. "Well, you guys hold up post, I'll give her a quick walk around."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you so much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, but I'm going to tell the boss!" "Fine! I don't get this chance very often!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I wave off from the alley that I snuck in to.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, go do your shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You do your shit, that you do! Then I head back through the shadows.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoosh! Damn it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You ask around, and it takes a while, especially since as a dragonborn some folks are like, "Oh, I'm not talking to you!" Some others are like, "Oh, yeah, right over that way!" It's a completely wrong direction, so it takes you a good two hours to eventually find your way to House Thunderbrand. When you get there, it's a beautiful alabaster building: large, white dome, with small spires built in to one of the more elevated ceilings of Kraghammer proper. On the outside, there is no gate, just an open lawn. You see grass, you see normally outside flora and fauna currently adorning the scape around this structure.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Whoa. Well, this is a lovely sight! I'm going to saunter on up to the door!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice! Go ahead and make a perception check.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Where is my perception--? Oh. Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Five? You saunter right up to the edge of the grass line, and get one step on what suddenly becomes visible to you: a rather subtly carved dwarven rune in the ground. In fact, there's a bunch of them, outlining the entirety of the grass. As your foot hits the rune, you're like, "Oh, that's a dwarven rune!" (stomping)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a good voice!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (as Tiberius) I've been practicing my Tiberius.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's close.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll a dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Uh-oh. Saving throw?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You got it, Tiberius!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What is this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dexterity.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh! That's a 15.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You manage to pull back to lessen the impact, but a bolt of bluish energy bursts out from the rune in front of you, throwing you about three or four feet behind the rune. You catch yourself. You do suffer eight points of thunder damage.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Damn gated communities.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is why we go to brothels instead of sneaking around at night!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep! No lightning attacks!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a whole different kind of damage you can suffer!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Okay. Well, I dust myself off. Apparently, there's some security. Hello?! Anything happen?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You wait about two or three minutes, no response.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Two to three minutes? That's a long time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have a feeling they're not going to respond to the crazy guy.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Very well.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What're you two doing?

lines.name: TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: We're making comment cards! Yes!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're all going to have comment cards that you are expected to fill out when you return back to the bar!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hugely important!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, because-- what was it? Baldus, Beldus?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Balgus?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Balan! Balan was so nice!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There we go. Balgus and Balan.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What do I see around the place? Do I see any large rocks, or any large pillars that I can--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Best from what you can tell at this distance, because it's fairly dark down here: the building itself has four corner spires around the large central dome structure. Each one of these spires is a very thin, tall, alabaster spire that at the very top is crested with some sort of bluish crystal that comes to a point. They're probably a good 35, 40 feet tall. About as tall as the rest of the structure is. You can't really tell how far back the structure goes because it meets with the back of the cave wall.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to-- okay. I'm going to shoot a Fireball. Right in front of me, roll it like a bowling ball. Just right to the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's a baby right there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are four feet from the door.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh! I'm four feet from the door? I don't do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can step back and do it.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm only four feet from the door? Oh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It pushed you back four feet from the rune you stepped on. You're not at the door.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I use that magical earring that we have?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You don't know what's going on there!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Episode one. Tiberius kills himself.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't die! I should have come with you! Then I could--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Bowl that Fireball, dude!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone is level nine currently in the game.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I use Mage Hand. I knock on the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From that far away? Okay, the arcane energy swirls up and forms this loosely hand-like appendage that drifts forward. As soon as it crosses over the rune where you stepped on, there is a spark of energy and the hand is dispelled.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Damn these runes. Okay, fine. I will do Glacial Blast right up to the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: But not to the door.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're alone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it reaches the front of the rune, there is another spark of energy and the ice forms up against an invisible barrier that's there and then the ice that's up against the barrier melts extremely quickly, drifting into a puddle of water.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Shit. I turn back and head to the group.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you turn around there are four Carvers that are hurrying towards you now, with their hammers out going, "You!"

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They all surround you on all sides, you have a dwarf on each corner. "You have attacked one of "the great dwarven families of Kraghammer! Name yourself and your business before you are under arrest."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Don't speak to me in that manner, I am Tiberius Stormwind!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I am snoring after having sex.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make intimidation check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What's your business?"

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I understand that, and I am sorry for losing my temper. I was just looking to ask questions of particular artifacts I have been looking for and this house is the only known arcane house I know that I was pointed to. I tried to reach them and communicate, but I was stopped by the stupid rune I can't figure out! I was turning back to get my tavern to get some rest and come back and try to contact the family the next day! Then I was stopped by you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've just arrived to New York City, I'm going to smash the doors open.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The dwarf guards look at each other and one of them steps forward and this guy you can see now he has more carvings in his armor, he looks to have a little more rank than the other ones. He steps forward, ruddy brown beard, his eyes itself are pitch black. There is almost no color to the irises. He goes, "Look. I'm letting you off this once, but if you so much as spit in the direction "of any other dwarf in the city, we're going to bury you so far underneath the dungeon you won't "see the light of day 'til the day you rot, you hear me, dragonborn?"

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I mean yes, my hearing is perfectly fine.

lines.name: MATT
